l.t: Reduces the cost of repairing bedrooms.
Reduces the cost of any tokens of appreciation given to clients.
Reduces the amount of time it takes for employees to give clients a token of your appreciation.
Reduces the amount of client dissatisfaction caused by moving a client to another room.
Reduces the cost of building extensions to your hotel.
Reduces the chances that a bedroom is destroyed by a client.
Increases the chances that a token of appreciation increases a client's satisfaction.
When you sacrifice a client at the Institute of Happiness, there is a chance that your other clients won't lose satisfaction points.
Lets you know exactly when the client will make their next request (click on them, then use the "examine" option).
Increases the base satisfaction score of all future Blobs.
Reduces the chances of Pyromaniacs destroying their bedroom (the chances of equipment being destroyed will remain unchanged).
Increases the base satisfaction score of all future Hysterical Types.
Increases the chances of a client leaving an object behind when they leave.
Significantly decreases the weekly tax payment.
Reduces the chances that any equipment in the rooms will be destroyed when guests leave.
For each guest sacrificed at the Institute of happiness, you will have a slight chance of obtaining a decorative item.
